title: Quantum Flow
imageAlt: Abstract visualization of quantum particles flowing in a grid, representing high-performance data visualization.
summary: A high-performance dashboard for quantum computing visualization with real-time telemetry.
description: Quantum Flow is a specialized visualization platform designed for researchers and engineers working with quantum hardware. It provides a real-time view into qubit coherence, gate fidelity, and error rates using advanced 2D and 3D data representations.
challenges: Visualizing high-dimensional quantum states in a way that is intuitive and performant was the primary challenge. Real-time updates from telemetry streams required a highly optimized rendering pipeline.
solutions: I implemented a custom rendering engine using Astro's islands architecture to minimize JavaScript. For the data visualization, I used specialized SVG patterns and Motion One for hardware-accelerated animations.

title: Eco-Trace
imageAlt: Clean, green energy and sustainability icons representing carbon footprint tracking.
summary: Track your carbon footprint and discover sustainable local businesses with gamified social features.
description: Eco-Trace is a community-driven mobile application that helps users reduce their environmental impact. It combines accurate carbon tracking with a social platform that rewards sustainable choices.
challenges: Aggregating accurate carbon data from multiple lifestyle sources (transport, diet, energy) while maintaining a low-friction user experience was difficult. Building a robust gamification system that kept users engaged was also a priority.
solutions: I built a modular API wrapper for various carbon footprint databases and implemented a React Native frontend with smooth gesture-based interactions. The backend used Firebase for real-time social updates and secure data storage.

title: Neural Notes
imageAlt: Conceptual representation of neural networks and interconnected nodes, symbolizing AI-powered note organization.
summary: AI-powered note-taking app that automatically organizes and links ideas using vector embeddings.
description: Neural Notes transforms fragmented ideas into a structured knowledge graph. Using large language models, it analyzes your notes to suggest connections, summarize long entries, and automatically categorize content based on meaning.
challenges: Managing low-latency AI responses while processing large amounts of text content in real-time. Designing a visual knowledge graph that remained usable even with hundreds of nodes.
solutions: I implemented a streaming response system using OpenAI's API and leveraged Pinecone for vector search. The graph visualization was built using React Force Graph with custom styling to match the portfolio's aesthetic.

title: Titan UI
imageAlt: Code editor showing a modern design system components, representing Titan UI library.
summary: A robust, accessible design system library for enterprise-scale React applications.
description: Titan UI is a comprehensive component library designed for consistency and accessibility in large-scale applications. It features over 50+ modular components with full TypeScript support and WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliance out of the box.
challenges: Ensuring perfect accessibility (ARIA patterns, keyboard navigation) across all components while allowing for deep customization via Tailwind CSS.
solutions: I leveraged Radix UI primitives as a foundation and built a custom styling layer on top. Every component was rigorously tested using Axe and manual screen reader audits. Documentation was generated using Storybook for an interactive developer experience.

title: Glow Logic
imageAlt: Modern smart home interior with ambient lighting, representing Glow Logic automation.
summary: A smart home automation dashboard focusing on ambient lighting and energy efficiency.
description: Glow Logic is an open-source home automation platform that prioritizes local control and privacy. It connects to various smart lighting systems and provides a unified, beautiful interface for managing your home's atmosphere.
challenges: Integrating disparate IoT protocols into a single, cohesive dashboard without significant latency. Ensuring the system remained stable during network fluctuations.
solutions: I used MQTT as the primary communication protocol and built a Node.js gateway to bridge different devices. The frontend used React with WebSocket for real-time state updates, ensuring a lag-free user experience.
